item.title: If the whale sets 10 large goals, the Ethereum long positions will be uncovered, resulting in a maximum potential loss of $7.5 million.
item.description: On August 20th, the long position of the Ethereum whale "First Set 10 Big Goals" remains open. It holds more than 31,000 ETH with a leverage of over 5 times. Potentially, it is facing an unrealized loss of $7.5 million with the position unchanged. The initial margin is $27.26 million, the entry price is $4399.13, and the liquidation price is $2655.41.BlockBeats previously reported that on August 16th. According to a position screenshot shared by the whale "First Set 10 Big Goals" at 20:24 on that day, the whale had a long position of more than 31,000 ETH with an entry price of $4399.13 and a leverage of over 5 times. The liquidation price was $2655.41, and the current unrealized loss was more than $640,000.

item.title: The Strategy stock price has dropped to a near four-month low, with Saylor stating that the company will loosen restrictions on issuing more shares.
item.description: On August 20th, the stock price of Michael Saylor-led Strategy (MSTR) dropped to a nearly four-month low. This was due to an overall decline in cryptocurrency treasury companies, a pullback in Bitcoin's price, and Saylor's statement that the company would relax restrictions on issuing more stock.Since Monday, MSTR's stock price has fallen by 8%. Meanwhile, Bitcoin, which hit a historic high of $124,128 last Thursday, has dropped by 8.6% to $113,631. Saylor posted on social media on Monday: "Strategy has announced today an update to the MSTR stock ATM (additional issuance) policy to provide greater flexibility in the execution of our capital allocation strategy." He also attached a chart showing the company's ability to issue stock at levels below the previous restrictions.The updated policy states that when MSTR's trading price is less than 2.5 times the net asset value (mNAV), the company can "strategically issue MSTR" to pay debt interest, fund preferred stock dividends, or opera

item.title: Bitcoin Withdrawal Slowdown, 24h Net Inflow of 2,364.99 BTC to CEX
item.description: On August 20th, according to Coinglass data, within the past 24 hours, the total net inflow of BTC in CEX was 2,364.99 coins. The top three CEXs in terms of inflow volume are as follows:· Binance with a net inflow of 1,945.80 BTC;· Bitfinex with a net inflow of 1,586.08 BTC;· Kraken with a net inflow of 1,272.34 BTC.In addition, Coinbase Pro witnessed a net outflow of 2,364.99 BTC and ranked first in terms of outflow.BlockBeats previously reported that the withdrawal momentum of Ethereum paused, with a net inflow of 73,000 ETH in the past 24 hours on CEX.

item.title: Ethereum Withdrawal Momentum Paused, with a 24-hour Net Inflow of 73,000 ETH to CEX
item.description: On August 20th, based on Coinglass data, in the past 24 hours, the total net inflow of Ethereum on CEX was 73,000 ETH. The top three CEX exchanges in terms of inflow volume are as follows:- Binance, with an inflow of 151,900 ETH;- OKX, with an inflow of 14,600 ETH;- Bitfinex, with an inflow of 2,409.42 ETH.In addition, Coinbase Pro had an outflow of 105,200 ETH and ranked first in the outflow list.

item.title: Eugene: Long on Ethereum with a Small Position, Seeking a Short-term Opportunity in the $4400-4600 Range
item.description: On August 20th, trader Eugene Ng Ah Sio shared on his personal channel: "I have established a small long position at this level in Ethereum. After realizing profits at $4700, I am engaging in range trading. Currently, I am mainly focusing on seeking short-term opportunities within the $4400-$4600 range. Then, I will evaluate whether to continue searching for higher positions."It is crucial to bear in mind that my risk exposure in these trades has now become significantly lower compared to before because the risk/reward ratio (r/r) of these trades is lower (although it is still positive).

item.title: Bridge Capital Founder: Holds a Significant Amount of Bitcoin, Sticks to End-of-Year Bitcoin Price Target of $180,000-$200,000
item.description: August 20th. Anthony Scaramucci, the founder and CEO of SkyBridge Capital, reiterated on Tuesday that despite the recent market correction, he still maintains his year-end price target for Bitcoin between $180,000 and $200,000. In an interview with CNBC, Anthony discussed the current situation of the Bitcoin market:“I think the market is currently experiencing a lot of consolidation at present, while institutions are continuously entering. If you had attended a similar conference three years ago, most of the attendees were retail investors and some CEOs engaged in Layer1 blockchain. But today, a greater number of attendees are institutional investors,” he said. Some large investors are selling their Bitcoin holdings, resulting in some consolidation in the market. However, he remains optimistic about Bitcoin in the medium term, citing that demand exceeds supply.Anthony himself and his SkyBridge fund hold “a significant amount of Bitcoin.” Previously, he has also stated that 70% of his

item.title: A whale converted 3,900 ETH to 143.26 WBTC, at a rate of 0.03673
item.description: On August 20th, as per the monitoring of lookIntoChain, with the decrease in the ETH/BTC ratio, Whale Address 0x6e17 exchanged 3,900 ETH (approximately $16.26 million) for 143.26 WBTC at an exchange rate of 0.03673.

item.title: If Ethereum breaks $4300, the total short liquidation on mainstream CEX will reach $2.411 billion.
item.description: On August 20th, based on Coinglass data, if Ethereum breaks through $4300, the cumulative short liquidation intensity on major CEXs will amount to $2.411 billion.Conversely, if Ethereum drops below $4000, the cumulative long liquidation intensity on major CEXs will reach $1.314 billion.BlockBeats Note: The liquidation chart does not disclose the exact number of contracts awaiting liquidation or the precise value of contracts being liquidated. The bars on the liquidation chart actually represent the significance of each liquidation cluster in relation to neighboring clusters, that is, intensity.Therefore, the liquidation chart shows to what degree the target price will be influenced when it reaches a specific level. A higher "liquidation bar" indicates that once the price reaches that level, it will undergo a more intense reaction due to a liquidity cascade.

item.title: US Treasury Secretary Bets on Stablecoins as Key Buyers of US Debt, Driving Cryptocurrency Integration into the Financial Mainstream
item.description: On August 20th, as per the Financial Times, US Treasury Secretary Yellen is wagering that the cryptocurrency industry will serve as a key purchaser of US debt in the forthcoming years given that the US government aims to meet the substantial demand for new bonds.Those with knowledge of the matter stated that Yellen has solicited information from major stablecoin issuers like Tether and Circle, and these discussions are influencing the Treasury Department's plans to enhance the sales of short-term Treasury bills in the upcoming quarters.The US Treasury Department hopes that stablecoins will emerge as a crucial source of demand for US government bonds, signifying the latest indication of the White House's endeavor to incorporate cryptocurrency into the core of the US financial system. Jay Barry, the global head of rates strategy at JPMorgan, one of the largest bond market traders, said, "Secretary Yellen and the Treasury undoubtedly view stablecoins as a genuine source of new demand

item.title: Monad Testnet Weekly Transaction Volume Plunges by 44.4%, Weekly Active Address Count Surges by 47.16%
item.description: On August 20th, according to Dune Data, the weekly transaction count on the Monad testnet sharply dropped to 66.16 million, which is a 44.4% decrease. Meanwhile, the weekly active addresses witnessed a significant 47.16% increase and reached 3.28 million.The total address count on the testnet has now reached 309 million, and 97,063 new addresses were added in the past 24 hours.
